file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-41-00-04 - HYDRAULIC COMPARTMENT&BATTERY COMPARTMENT ACCESS DOORS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL HYDRAULIC COMPARTMENT&BATTERY COMPARTMENT ACCESS DOORS - REMOVAL/ INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the hydraulic compartment and battery compartment access doors. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY HYDRAULIC COMPARTMENT & BAT- ALL 52-41-00-000-801-A TERY COMPARTMENT ACCESS DOORS - REMOVAL HYDRAULIC COMPARTMENT & BAT- ALL 52-41-00-400-801-A TERY COMPARTMENT ACCESS DOORS - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-41-00 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-41-00-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. HYDRAULIC COMPARTMENT & BATTERY COMPARTMENT ACCESS DOORS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the hydraulic compartment and battery compartment access doors. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113DL Forward fuselage 114 114CR Forward fuselage D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward fuselage I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open the hydraulic compartment door and/or battery compartment access doors 114CR and 113DL (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100). (2) Disconnect the jumper (2) from the access door. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the nuts (3), washers(4) and bolts(5) to disconnect the two arms (1) from the two supports (6). (2) Remove the access door. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Hydraulic Compartment and Battery Compartment Access Doors - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B STA 2159.0 B A ZONES STA 113 1667.0 114 DET. A (6) (1) (5) (2) (4) (3) 145AMM520550.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-41-00 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-41-00-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. HYDRAULIC COMPARTMENT & BATTERY COMPARTMENT ACCESS DOORS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the hydraulic compartment and battery compartment access doors. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-30-00/100 - AMM MPP 20-40-02/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113DL Forward fuselage 114 114CR Forward fuselage D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-S-8802 Sealant PR1440B2 type II AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward fuselage I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the two arms (1) of the access door in the two supports (6) and attach them with the bolts (5), washers (4), and nuts (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-41-00 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Connect the jumper (2) to the access door. (2) Measure the electrical resistance between the latches of the door and the grounding point at the nose landing gear ( AMM MPP 20-40-02/200). The resistance value can not be greater than 150 milliohms. NOTE: • Make sure that the equipment operates correctly and the points of contact are cleaned. • If the resistance value is greater than 150 milliohms, remake the connection. (3) Apply a coat of sealant (PR1440B2 Type II class B2) over the screw that attaches the end of the jumper to restore the original finish. (4) Close the hydraulic compartment door and/or battery compartment access doors 114CR and 113DL (AMM MPP 06-30-00/100).
